questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'That can't be her brother. He _____ be older.'
Which option expresses a strong conclusion about a past event?
options: He must have taken the wrong train.
He might take the wrong train.
He should take the wrong train.
He can have taken the wrong train.
questions.answer: He must have taken the wrong train.

questions.question: Choose the best modal: 'This room is a mess. Someone _____ have broken in.'
Which sentence shows a deduction about something that is likely not true?
options: She must be at the meeting.
She can't be at the meeting.
She might be at the meeting.
She should be at the meeting.
questions.answer: She can't be at the meeting.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'He looks very pale. He _____ be feeling well.'
What modal best completes the sentence: 'The lights are on. They _____ be home.'
Choose the sentence that expresses past impossibility.
options: They can't have arrived on time.
questions.answer: They can't have arrived on time.

questions.question: Complete the sentence: 'He _____ have known the answer if he had studied.'
